title: 425 women jailed during this year: PM
byline: Some 425 women have been convicted and sent to jail from January 1 to August 31 this year, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament today.

title: Opposition MPs urge for action on privilege issues without delay
byline: Opposition Members of Parliament including Rohana Bandara and Jagath Withana today called for action on the privilege issues raised by them in Parliament several days ago.

title: Major US airports see delays as government shutdown hits air travel
byline: US air travellers are experiencing a second day of flight delays and cancellations, as the government shutdown causes a worsening shortage of air traffic controllers.

title: RTI appeal filed over refusal to disclose President’s domestic travel costs
byline: A YouTuber who has consistently sought information relating to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s domestic travel costs, has submitted an appeal to the Right to Information (RTI) Commission, challenging the decision of the Presidential Secretariat’s Designated Officer to reject his information.

title: Ten women conceive as sperm bank brings hope
byline: The newly established sperm bank at Castle Street Hospital for Women in Colombo has produced encouraging results with ten women successfully conceiving through the facility’s services, hospital officials said.

title: Police warn public against rising online financial frauds
byline: The Sri Lanka Police have issued an urgent warning to the public about the growing number of financial frauds being committed through social media platforms, particularly on Telegram, WhatsApp, and other online groups.

title: Gazette issues to curb spread of African Swine Fever
byline: An extraordinary gazette notification has been issued to prevent the further spread of African swine fever (ASF), which has affected several Divisional Secretariats across the country in recent months.

title: Threat of power cuts looms?
byline: The country is at risk of facing power cuts and potential instability following the Electricity Engineers’ Union’s decision to suspend all work regulations from 4:15 p.m. yesterday, intensifying its ongoing trade union action, Samagi Joint Trade Union Alliance Convener Ananda Palitha warned.
